result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven C Spencer

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven C Spencer in court, in custody.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Steven C Spencer.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Plea is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made. Defendant will plead Guilty to count 1 in 22CF151, Guilty to count 1 & 2 in 22cf282 and all remaining charges to be dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Venema is withdrawing motion hearing set for 22CF343 and states there is a global resolution. Atty Venema states his client is satisfied by taking plea by video. Court asked Defendant if he would like to be brought over and enter the plea in person. Defendant wishes to enter plea by video, Court is satisfied and continues with plea hearing. 

Atty Venema stipulates to prior convictions on enhancements.  

SEH set for 12/5/22 @ 11 am
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven C Spencer in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Steven C Spencer. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

Defendant in court in custody via video with attorney Keith Venema. ADA Crawford appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is on for a preliminary hearing. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Information will mirror complaint and to be efiled. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Matter set over with KED 8-16 at 115pm.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven C Spencer in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Steven C Spencer. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Steven C Spencer in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Steven C Spencer. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. SPD needs time to re appoint Attorney. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven C Spencer in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Prior bond forfeited. New total bond set. Future dates remain. Minutes filed.

BOND TO COVER 22GF632, 22CF151, 22CF282, & 21CM237

DEFENDANT MUST NOT DRIVE AT ALL. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2867 thru 2872

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven C Spencer not in court. Attorney Keith Venema appears specially. Attorney Venema not appointed to this case. Attorney requesting week long adjournment. Minutes filed.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Summons Cover Letter to Defendant
